p: Statistical methods can also influence whether or not temperature is significantly related to disease in a region. For example, temperature was correlated with JEV in Nepal, but was not retained in a final model when other covariates were considered (precipitation, the percentage of irrigated land, the percentage of grassland cover, and the pig-to-human ratio) [ 226]. Therefore, models may show a temperature effect, but the effect may disappear when another relevant covariate is included.
